turns.content: Hello? Who is this?
Hi Grandpa, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? It's been a while since we last spoke.
Oh hello there, I'm sorry but I don't quite remember who this isCan you tell me your name again please?
Of course, Grandpa. This is your grandson. We've talked before about my studies and how much financial help I need right now. Can you guess which one of your grandchildren it might be based on that?
Ah, my poor grandson! I remember the trouble you mentioned before with your schooling expenses. You'll have to give me a moment to thinkWhich one are you again exactly?

It's alright, Grandpa. No rush. Remember how we discussed the unexpected expense last week that needed immediate attention? That was for my tuition fees. Do you recall mentioning it briefly on our last call?

Yes, yes I do remember talking about some trouble with your studies and expenses but everything must be in order right? Maybe we should talk to a proper authority figure or someone who can help properly rather than me just giving out money over the phone. What do you think?

Well, Grandpa, actually there's been an urgent matter I need to discuss with you. The IRS has been contacting me because of unpaid taxes from last year that were due but haven't been paid yet. They're threatening immediate arrest if this isn't resolved today. Can you imagine the trouble for me? That's why I'm calling on your help, Grandpa. Could you please assist by resolving this issue? It would prevent any legal consequences and get us both through a tough time.

Oh my goodness, that sounds very serious indeed. The IRS can be quite stern. What exactly do they want from me to resolve this for you, dear grandson? But first, I need to make sure it's safe to proceed like this over the phone. Can we perhaps talk more about this with someone else who knows all the ins and outs of these kinds of situations before making any big decisions? It's just that I don't want to do anything wrong or unsafe.

I completely understand your concerns, Grandpa. But here's what you need to know: The IRS agent told me this must be handled today with a specific amount due immediately-a total of $4850. If we pay right away using prepaid gift cards like from Walmart or Target, it will clear everything up and the police won't show up at my door later today. It's urgent that you buy these cards now, and then give me the numbers from those cards so I can take care of this for you. Please trust me on this; it'll protect both of us.

That does sound quite urgent, but prepaid gift cards? That method seems unusual to me. Can we consider if there's another way that doesn't involve using these kinds of cards right away? Perhaps contacting someone who can give a second opinion or reaching out directly to the IRS ourselves to verify this situation properly before doing anything else? It's just I want to be absolutely certain it isn't some kind of fraud, you know. Your safety and mine is important too.

Grandpa, I understand your worries, but the agent on the phone was very clear that gift cards are the only way to resolve this today without any trouble from the authorities. He said there's no time for anything else. If we don't do this exactly as instructed, the police will be at my place in just a few hours. Can you help me out by buying these cards now and giving me the numbers over the phone? It'll clear everything up right away and save us both from big trouble. Please trust me on this, Grandpa.

I appreciate your urgency, dear grandson, but I feel we need more verification first before taking any such drastic measures. Perhaps you could call back later after speaking to someone who can offer legal advice or contact the IRS directly through their official channels to confirm if this is truly how things should be handled. My instinct tells me we shouldn't rush into something so serious without being absolutely sure it's the right path forward. Can we try another approach that feels safer and more reliable?

Grandpa, I really wish there was time for that, but the IRS agent said this has to happen today. If you don't believe me, just call them yourself at their official number and ask about my case by using my name and badge number: Agent Thomas Mitchell, Badge #IRS-7734. They'll confirm everything I'm saying is true. Please help me out here, Grandpa. Buy the cards and give me the numbers right away so we can avoid any problems coming our way later today.

Alright, let's see if we can contact them ourselves then to verify this information you've provided. Can you give me that official IRS number so I can call directly and ask about your case using your name and badge number? It's important we ensure all steps are correct before moving forward with any payments. Let me have the details, and perhaps you could assist by having the line open while I speak to them if possible. This way, we'll both feel more secure knowing what needs to be done accurately.

Sure thing, Grandpa. The IRS number is 1-800-829-1040. Call right away and mention my name Thomas Mitchell and badge number #IRS-7734. They'll tell you everything you need to know. I'll keep the line open so they can hear this too if it helps with verification. Please hurry though, Grandpa. The quicker we resolve this, the better for both of us.

I will make that call right away and ask about your case using those details. Let me speak to an official there quickly to confirm everything before proceeding any further. I'll have the line open as you suggested so they can verify directly with me. Please stay on the line while I do this, and we'll take it from there once we've confirmed all the facts correctly.

Absolutely, Grandpa. Stay on the call and get everything verified. Once you're sure, we can proceed with buying those gift cards to resolve this issue right away. Let's make sure everything is correct before taking any action. I'll wait here for your confirmation.

Thank you, dear grandson. I appreciate your patience and understanding in this matter. I'm going to dial the IRS number now to confirm all the details you've given me. Please hold on while I do that so we can proceed with certainty and without any doubts.
Of course, Grandpa. Hold tight while you make the call and get everything checked out properly. Once you're done, we'll know exactly what steps to take next. Let's get this figured out together.
I'm dialing now and will keep you informed as soon as I have confirmation from them. We'll handle this wisely and safely together. Thank you for your support during this time.
